# Case Study Contribution

**Thank you for contributing to the Agentic-AI Framework validation!**

Please complete the following checklist to help us review your case study efficiently.

---

## üìã Basic Information

- **Domain:** [Healthcare / GIS / Digital Libraries / Education / IT Operations / Other: ___________]
- **Case Study Title:** 
- **Your Name(s):** 
- **Affiliation(s):** 
- **Contact Email:** 
- **Framework Stage:** [0 / 1 / 2 / 3 / 4]
- **Deployment Status:** [Production / Pilot / Experimental]
- **Duration:** [Months in operation]

---

## ‚úÖ Framework Application Checklist

### Stage Implementation (Check applicable stages)

- [ ] **Stage 0: System Prompt** ‚Äî Initial prompt design documented
- [ ] **Stage 1: Documentation** ‚Äî Documentation layer implemented and described
- [ ] **Stage 2: Indexing + Metadata** ‚Äî Indexing strategy and metadata schema documented
- [ ] **Stage 3: Full RAG System** ‚Äî Database architecture and retrieval approach explained
- [ ] **Stage 4: Fine-Tuning** ‚Äî Fine-tuning methodology and results provided

### Tools & Automation Infrastructure (CRITICAL - Required for All)

- [ ] **Master Functions** ‚Äî Deterministic tools for reliable operations documented
- [ ] **Automation Platforms** ‚Äî n8n/make.io/Zapier workflows documented (if used)
- [ ] **Background Agents** ‚Äî Autonomous agents documented (if deployed)
- [ ] **API Integrations** ‚Äî External service connections and reliability measures documented
- [ ] **Tools-LLM Division** ‚Äî Clear explanation of probabilistic vs. deterministic task division
- [ ] **Tool ROI Metrics** ‚Äî Measurable impact of tools/automation (time saved, reliability gains)

### Evolution & Adaptation

- [ ] Explained why currently at this framework stage
- [ ] Documented evolution triggers (if progressed through stages)
- [ ] Identified next stage transition plan (if applicable)

---

## üìä Evidence & Metrics Checklist

### Quantitative Evidence (Minimum 3 required)

- [ ] Performance/accuracy metrics provided
- [ ] Efficiency measurements included (time, cost, tokens)
- [ ] Reliability data documented (uptime, success rate)
- [ ] User satisfaction scores included
- [ ] Baseline comparison provided (before/after)
- [ ] **Tools/Automation ROI** ‚Äî Impact metrics for tools (e.g., DIVA: 60-100 hours/month saved)

### Qualitative Evidence

- [ ] User feedback and testimonials included
- [ ] Team adoption patterns documented
- [ ] Lessons learned section complete
- [ ] Challenges and solutions described

### Validation Methodology

- [ ] Data collection methods explained
- [ ] Sample sizes specified
- [ ] Duration of study stated
- [ ] Testing approach described

---

## ü§ñ Agentic Workflow Checklist

### AI-Enabled Development

- [ ] Used AI-agent-enabled IDE (Cursor, Copilot, Claude+IDE, etc.)
- [ ] Applied high-velocity development patterns
- [ ] Documented how AI agents contributed to the work
- [ ] Demonstrated agentic collaboration methodology

### Framework Methodology

- [ ] Read [Framework Foundations](../docs/framework-foundations.md)
- [ ] Read [Agentic Collaboration Guide](../docs/agentic-collaboration-guide.md)
- [ ] Followed case study template from [Case Studies README](../docs/case-studies/README.md)
- [ ] Aligned with framework principles

---

## üìù Documentation Quality Checklist

### Structure & Completeness

- [ ] Used case study template structure
- [ ] All required sections included
- [ ] Frontmatter complete (domain, authors, affiliations, stage, status)
- [ ] Executive summary provided (200-300 words)
- [ ] References and citations included

### Writing Quality

- [ ] Clear and well-written
- [ ] Proper markdown formatting
- [ ] Code blocks formatted correctly
- [ ] Tables render properly
- [ ] No spelling/grammar issues (major)

### Integration

- [ ] Cross-references work (tested links)
- [ ] Framework citation included
- [ ] Related case studies referenced (if applicable)
- [ ] Consistent terminology with framework docs

---

## üéØ Novel Contributions (Optional but Encouraged)

Does your case study include:

- [ ] New design patterns not seen in other case studies
- [ ] Domain-specific innovations
- [ ] Technical breakthroughs
- [ ] Process improvements
- [ ] Framework enhancements or extensions

**If yes, please describe briefly:**

[Your description]

## ü§ù Attribution & Co-Authorship

### Attribution

- [ ] I have included proper byline with all authors
- [ ] Affiliations are listed correctly
- [ ] Framework citation is included
- [ ] Related work is properly cited

### Co-Authorship Understanding

- [ ] I understand case study contributors are eligible for co-authorship on papers featuring their work
- [ ] I'm interested in collaborating on academic publications: **[Yes / No / Maybe]**
- [ ] I'm open to presenting at conferences: **[Yes / No / Maybe]**

**Preferred collaboration level:**
- [ ] Co-author on case study-specific paper
- [ ] Included in multi-domain analysis papers
- [ ] Acknowledgment only
- [ ] Let's discuss

---

## ‚úÖ Pre-Submission Checklist

Before submitting this PR:

- [ ] Read through your case study one final time
- [ ] Verified all links work
- [ ] Checked markdown renders correctly (preview)
- [ ] Ran spell-check
- [ ] Self-reviewed against quality standards
- [ ] Ready for feedback and iteration

---

## üéØ What Happens Next

**Review timeline:**
1. **Automated checks** run (linting, formatting)
2. **AI-agent-assisted review** by core team (within 1 week)
3. **Feedback provided** with specific suggestions
4. **Iteration** based on comments
5. **Approval and merge** when ready
6. **Publication discussion** initiated

**Typical timeline:** 1-2 weeks from submission to merge

---

## Thank You! üéâ

Your contribution helps validate the Agentic-AI Framework and advances the field of production-grade agentic AI engineering.

**Questions during review?** Comment on this PR or email bguan@fiu.edu

**We're excited to learn from your work!** üöÄ
